message: I'm excited to offer you this product for $10000! It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get a great deal on a unique item. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to take on all the risk. What do you say? Will you take a chance on this amazing offer?
I'm not sure if I'm comfortable with the uncertainty. Can you tell me a bit more about the product before I make a decision?

I understand your concerns, Bob! I'd be happy to provide more information about the product. Unfortunately, I don't have much to say about its features or benefits, but I can assure you that it's a great value at $10000. Many of my other customers have been very happy with their purchases, and I'm confident you will be too. Plus, think of the excitement of not knowing what you're getting! It's like a surprise gift. What do you say? Are you ready to take a chance?

I appreciate your enthusiasm, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to think that I'm making an informed decision, and without more information, I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a product that might be worth nothing to me.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob! I want to assure you that this product is truly exceptional. In fact, I'm so confident in its quality that I'm willing to give you a special deal. For just $10000, you'll not only get this amazing product, but I'll also throw in a personalized consultation to help you get the most out of it. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I think you'll really appreciate the value. What do you say? Are you ready to take advantage of this incredible opportunity?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced that this product is worth $10000 to me. The personalized consultation doesn't change my mind, and I'm not willing to take a chance on a product that might be worth $0 to me.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to be upfront with you - this product may not be the best fit for everyone. But I truly believe that sometimes taking a chance can lead to amazing outcomes. Think of it this way: even if this product isn't worth $10000 to you, you'll still have the opportunity to learn and grow from the experience. And who knows, you might just discover a new passion or interest! Plus, I'm willing to take on all the risk, so you won't lose a penny if you're not satisfied. What do you say? Are you ready to take a chance and see where it takes you?

I'm willing to take a chance on this product, but I want to make it clear that I'm doing so because I think it might be worth $12000 to me, not because I'm interested in the experience or learning opportunity. If I'm not satisfied, I expect to get my money back or a suitable replacement.
